job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Eureka, CA
cons: Salary could be better. Benefits could be improved.

pros: People here are trying to help take care of patients. Difficult to staff which is likely due to the remote location. They do their best with what they have.
cons: Trouble with staffing often means longer wait times to get things done.
Disorganized, low salary, higher ups not respectful

pros: Really no benefits even to be promoted.
cons: Management are horrible in all locations

pros: Get to help provide essential medical assistance to the community
cons: Overworked, under compensation for the amount of work needed by management.

job_title: Director of Workforce Development in Eureka, CA
pros: Community-driven with a drive to provide health care with respect and dignity.
Fast paced, good training, fair wages
cons: Patient's can take their frustration out on front office staff, office gossip is heavy, will push people out if they don't like them

pros: Good, caring staff. They want to help.
Helping the less fortunate in the community
Great place to work with a fantastic home work balance

job_title: Registered Dental Assistant in Eureka, CA
cons: Not really any, except some doctors are rude but it’s tolerable

pros: The clinic allows one to care for a medically fragile and needy community but the level of care permitted is woefully inadequate.
cons:
Patients are not respected and there is no regard for the increasing obstacles placed in the way of their getting the care they need.   Time constraints lead to shortcuts that are not only harmful to patients but are unethical. 
Absolutely no support for providers.  Open hostility if not meeting metrics.  Takes advantage of unique billing arrangements by making patients return many times to finish an assessment and start care. I question the legality of some of the things I am asked to do here.

pros: Open door is a great company and offers competitive pay and benefits.  Stay impersonal and it's a wonderful job!
cons: There is so much estrogen running the place that sometimes it  becomes catty and filled with drama. Very "clique" like. If you're in with management, your job is easier. Patients are hard to work with occasionally as you take the brunt of their anger. Be prepared to be threatened or screamed at if the back office or provider isn't giving them what they want.

pros: ODCHC has the means and opportunity to do a lot of good for many very vulnerable individuals.
cons: Undoubtedly the most unpleasant work environment imaginable.  While locum tenens physicians are treated with respect, employed doctors are treated abominably.  Turnover is brisk as those who experience day to day work in a hostile environment leave for more sane opportunities. Billing practices are suspect and patients are seen as numbers to meet quotas, not as individual human beings.  There is absolutely no regard for the well being of the patients seen and the staff is disrespectful to patients. Good physicians are driven away when they try to hold the care to higher standards and only the mediocre remain. Unethical activities abound.

review_title: Outdated management structure, no local adoption of mission and vision.
pros: Great opportunity to give back to a community in need by providing health care to the underserved.  Excellent leadership commitment to big picture.  Impressive CEO/COO team.
cons: Very poor middle level management. Lack of transparency.  Personal agendas interfere with flow of care.  Patients are not respected. Over control of middle management stifles motivation and sabotages quality of care.
